item.dc:creator: @Officer-Ahole Officer-Ahole
item.description:
@Officer-Ahole wrote:

[quote=“Kryptix, post:2, topic:333053”]The whole thread is a joke, but it’s worrying just how many people thought it was serious (mainly on MSN admittedly).

(16:49) Kryptix: i just released some code on mopar ;\
(16:49) Marwood: Oo
(16:50) Marwood: lol, xEnt will reply saying “you could have just looped that and only have a few lines of code”
(16:50) Kryptix: yeh but this is more effient
loops eat cpu
(16:50) Marwood: oh yes
(16:51) Kryptix: it’s better if you manually go through the exact number rather than loop
(16:51) Marwood: yeah
(16:51) Kryptix: watch the idiots flame tho
fucking hate mopar
(16:51) Marwood: now we just need to get you to release the SQL back end of loading NPC’s

I mean FFS, the ID doesn’t change but I’m still checking the object exists every fucking time, as well as logging every object rather than just logging it once. Not to mention that it could blatantly, blatantly be looped… Grrrr. :)[/quote]

For an obvious reason, I’m still not buying it.

item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

definitely going disagree on this one Kryptix.

 if (EntityHandler.getGameObjectDef(id) != null) {
                for(int i=0; i < 30; i++) {
                Server.requestWorldAccess().registerGameObject(new GameObject(player.getX() + i, player.getY() + i, id, defaultDirection, 0));
                Logger.mod(player.getUsername() + " spawned a " + EntityHandler.getGameObjectDef(id).getName() + " object at " + player.getX() + ", " +  player.getY());
                }
        } else {
                player.getActionSender().sendMessage("@gre@RSCE:@whi@ Invalid ID");
        }

not only doe that look better, it’s less instructions as it’s not checking the same thing (if the id is valid) 30 times. stick to php babe

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Ecko Ecko
item.description:
@Ecko wrote:

[quote=“The_AFKer, post:6, topic:333046”][quote author=Kryptix link=topic=429467.msg3153129#msg3153129 date=1268761071]
It’s more efficient doing it like that as loops kill CPU usage
[/quote]

You’re kidding right? Considering it’s a command, executing the loop couldn’t possibly hurt CPU usage. It would only hold true if others had objects called from the database…[/quote]
I’m with this.
